hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'And you are the most superior' from Surah Muhammad verse 35. Mujahid said: This means the victors, similar to the day of Uhud, meaning victory comes against them.

narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Shibaani

narrators.name: Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd ibn Hakim ibn Ibrahim ibn Qudamah ibn Mahan al-Basri

chainIssues: First two narrators (Abd al-Rahman and Ibrahim) are of unknown reliability (majhul al-hal), which significantly weakens the entire chain
Adam's reliability is unknown, further weakening the chain
Ibn Abi Najjih and Mujahid both use indirect transmission term (عَنْ) which introduces ambiguity in the connection
The chain passes through three narrators of unknown reliability before reaching known narrators

potential_issues.issue: Unknown narrators at the beginning of the chain
potential_issues.impact: Abd al-Rahman, Ibrahim, and Adam are all majhul al-hal (unknown in reliability). Their identities and trustworthiness are not established. This significantly weakens the entire chain.

potential_issues.issue: Indirect transmission terms at the end of the chain
potential_issues.impact: Both Ibn Abi Najjih and Mujahid use عَنْ (from) which could be direct or indirect. However, given that the earlier narrators are unknown, this amplifies concerns about connection.
This appears to be a tafsir (Quranic interpretation) attributed to Mujahid, making it mawquf (stopped at a Follower), not marfu' (traced to the Prophet). This affects how the hadith is graded.

Topics: Interpretation of Surah Muhammad verse 35 on superiority
Meaning of al-Aʻlawun (the most superior ones)
Comparison to the Battle of Uhud

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'And He will not diminish you in your deeds' from Surah Muhammad verse 35. Mujahid said: This means He will not decrease your deeds.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'He will substitute a people other than you' from Surah Muhammad verse 38. Mujahid said: This means He will substitute whomever He wills with whomever He wills.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'Indeed, We have opened for you a clear opening' from Surah al-Fath verse 1. Mujahid said: This means his (the Prophet's) sacrifice at Hudaybiyyah and his shaving of his head.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'He sent down al-Sakinah (tranquility)' from Surah al-Fath verse 4. Mujahid said: Al-Sakinah is from Allah the Mighty and Majestic in the form of wind, it has a head like the head of a cat and two wings.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'Those who were left behind from the Bedouins will say to you: Our properties and our families kept us occupied' from Surah al-Fath verse 11. Mujahid said: This means the Bedouins of Madinah, Juhaynah and Muzaynah tribes. When the Prophet ﷺ intended to go to Makkah, he called them to join him, saying: We will go with you against a people who came to you and killed your companions, so we will fight them in their land. But they made excuses due to their preoccupation. The Prophet ﷺ proceeded as a pilgrim (Umrah). His Companions seized some people from the people of the Haram unaware. The Prophet ﷺ then released them. That was the victory at the interior of Makkah, which is His saying: 'With victory at the interior of Makkah after He gave you victory over them' from Surah al-Fath verse 24. The Prophet ﷺ returned while Allah the Mighty and Majestic had promised him great spoils and hastened for him Khaybar. The ones left behind said: Let us follow you. These were the spoils about which Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: 'When you set out to take the spoils, let those who believe follow you' from Surah al-Fath verse 15. And there were presented to them fighting against people of strong military might, they are Persia and Rome. But as for the great spoils which they were promised, they did not obtain them until today.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'And you were a ruined people' from Surah al-Fath verse 12. Mujahid said: This means you were a people destroyed.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining the verse 'Those who are people of mighty strength' from Surah al-Fath verse 16. Mujahid said: They are Persia and Rome. Also narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: al-Mubarak ibn Fadala narrated to us, from al-Hasan, who said: They are Persia and Rome.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was shown a vision while he was at Hudaybiyyah that he entered Makkah, he and his Companions, safe and secure, shaving their heads and shortening their hair. When he sacrificed at Hudaybiyyah, his Companions said to him: Where is your vision, O Messenger of Allah? Then Allah the Mighty and Majestic revealed: Indeed Allah has truthfully fulfilled for His Messenger the vision in truth, from Surah al-Fath verse 27, until His saying: He has made for them besides it, a near opening (victory). This means the sacrifice at Hudaybiyyah. Then they returned and conquered Khaybar. Then after that he performed the pilgrimage (Umrah). So his vision was fulfilled in the following year.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, who said: Adam narrated to us, who said: Warqa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najjih, from Mujahid, explaining His saying the Mighty and Majestic: 'That is their description in the Torah and their description in the Gospel' from Surah al-Fath verse 29. Mujahid said: He means: Their description in the Torah and in the Gospel is one and the same. He said: Like a crop that has brought forth its sprout from Surah al-Fath verse 29. This means what springs forth by the side of a field. The first one becomes firm and the other becomes firm. Then he aided it from Surah al-Fath verse 29. This means he strengthened it and helped it. Then it becomes stout and stands firm upon its stems from Surah al-Fath verse 29. He says: So it reached its companions.
